programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy finds a way to lighten the mood in the hot California sun, but the bidding wars that ensue are anything but cool.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a draft of the original Star Wars script comes into the shop, Rick and Chum do everything they can to get this 'Obi-one of a kind' collectors' item.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys uncover a Miami Dolphins souvenir from the team's very beginnings, and meet a customer who claims to have unseen footage of President Franklin D Roosevelt.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The toss of a coin determines the value of a gold chain Les believes is out of fashion. A customer is upset when Seth prevents her from using the staff toilets.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman rejects custom-made earrings, as she thought the term diamond cut meant they were diamonds. Seth puts his faith into younger sellers, believing they can outperform Les.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron and Tyler discover a rusty pump that could be worth a fortune if properly restored - but first they need to persuade the owner to part with it.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team restore a gramophone from the 1920s and a 1915 cement gun that they discover was once put to a very different use.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator meets a man who claims to have climbed Everest 10 times without the need for extra oxygen.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The murder of a longtime resident of a California mountain town in 1997, a crime that stunned the community - and led to months of dogged investigation before the case came to a shocking conclusion.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor sets his sights on a scooter that could be worth 3,000 dollars, and Lesa spots a snake-skin ensemble.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers bid for some scruffy looking lockers, but appearances prove deceptive as the most unattractive units turn out to contain the most valuable contents.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: American Jewelry celebrates its 30th anniversary, and Les wants to put on a big celebration He assigns Seth and Ashley five days to plan it, but they clash over their ideas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A sloppy mistake puts the Golds' business in jeopardy, and a dispute on the shop floor gets out of hand.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Investigating reports of UFO and USO activity in the Bermuda Triangle vicinity of the Atlantic Undersea Test and Evaluation Centre - AUTEC - said to be used by the US Navy for weapons testing and underwater research.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts contemplate whether aliens could be causing natural disasters and wars in a bid to control the fate of the human race.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick takes on a huge challenge when a giant slide from the 1960s shaped like a rocket is brought into the shop a piece at a time.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A one-of-a-kind Star Wars Boba Fett prototype action figure jetpacks into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether Rick will pay the bounty.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick gives a limited edition 2014 Hertz Penske GT Mustang a test drive around the Las Vegas Motor Speedway.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A compilation of clips examining the series' most and least successful bidding tactics, from secret plots to Barry's bizarre schemes.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Special episode revisiting the bidders' most uproarious feuds.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: If I Were a Tibetin' Man
programme.desc: The bidders compete for a potentially profitable furniture locker, while Ricky and Bubba buy a collection of American football autographs, but need to check if they are genuine.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Lesa finds looking for fine art and designer furniture too stressful to cope with, and Roy thinks a theme park brochure from the 1970s will make him a profit.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After using high carbon steel to forge a hatchet, the two finalists must create an ancient Indian weapon used to both stab and slice.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.sub-title: A Photo a Tooth the Truth?
programme.desc: Two potentially game-changing discoveries are made in the Ozarks as the investigation into whether giant humanoids ever roamed America continues.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: UFOs are the biggest mystery of the age, yet somebody - or something - seems determined to keep it that way. This documentary seeks to assess why that may be the case.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Examining why different cultures have similar tales of monsters and giants, and questioning whether they could be genuine eye-witness accounts of extraterrestrials.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff at the Detroit family pawn shop encounter a gynaecologist's table and an elephant's skull.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les challenges Seth to a high-stakes sales competition, but later faces the most dangerous customer he has ever encountered.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The PA Stays in the Picture
programme.desc: The bidders attend a series of auctions in the southern Californian city of Rancho Cucamonga.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers attend a locker auction in Orange County, where Ivy Calvin ends up having to dig through a pile of rubbish.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autographed picture of John Belushi and a Jim Henson puppet arrive in the shop, but it remains to be seen if any of them are worth big money.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare Nepalese Bira gun from the late 1800s arrives in the shop, and a 1970s Bob Peak TWA mural makes a big impression.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Revisit the best items ever seen outside of the shop, including Rick's international trip to London where he finds some rare American maps, a vintage piano used by the Rat Pack and an exclusive tour of a Soviet fighter jet..

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A compilation of clips examining the series' most and least successful bidding tactics, from secret plots to Barry's bizarre schemes.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Special episode revisiting the bidders' most uproarious feuds.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on L-themed larks - a 'Liblabble', as he calls it. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and stand-ups Sara Pascoe and Bill Bailey.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts an edition of the comedy quiz show. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Tom Allen, Ari Eldjarn, Ed Gamble and Ellie Taylor. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions about lenses, lungs and legs. With comedian and The Last Leg co-host Josh Widdicombe, comedienne Jo Brand, Never Mind the Buzzcocks team captain and stand-up Phill Jupitus and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on L-themed larks - a 'Liblabble', as he calls it. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and stand-ups Sara Pascoe and Bill Bailey.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Four famous faces go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games across the week, with comedians Nish Kumar and Al Murray, Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo and broadcaster Anneka Rice the first contestants. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the weekly scores are tallied resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday, when the victor chooses between a House of Games dartboard and a branded dressing gown.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts an edition of the comedy quiz show. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Tom Allen, Ari Eldjarn, Ed Gamble and Ellie Taylor. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, as their bodycams prove crucial for gathering evidence and nailing criminals.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank take picking to a whole new level when they come across people who are not afraid to go big when it comes to collecting.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori buy storage units at an auction in Redondo Beach, where a safe sparks plenty of interest.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Tempers flare between Brandon and his wife Lori as the bidding at an auction soon escalates.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: The lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for iconic items that are as American as apple pie and baseball.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a disused shop, and visit a collector's garage where they find a motorcycle frame, a go-kart and some rare toys.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve faces his toughest challenge yet when he must design a tour bus that represents WelderUp while meeting the high standards of his business partners.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an edition first broadcast in 2007, Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May celebrate British Leyland's 40th birthday by trying to boost the reputation of the cars that once rolled off its production line. The Aston Martin DBS is put through its paces on the test track, Jennifer Saunders is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car and the team asks whatever happened to the beach buggy.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Police dog Jax and his handler Mat set out to catch the culprit of a spate of house burglaries in Cannock. Documentary following the work of Staffordshire police officers on the frontline as they tackle crime across Burton and Stoke-on-Trent.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve agrees to build a crazy 1970s-era gasser racecar for a US Navy veteran and tries to make money by restoring and flipping a Prohibition-era bootlegger Model A truck.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Reliant Robin to investigate the reasons behind the lack of three-wheeled cars on the market. The Stig takes the Bentley Continental Supersports for a spin around the test track, and James May fires up the Toyota Hilux for a final challenge - a gruelling drive up Eyjafjallajokull, an active Icelandic volcano that halted flights in British airspace in 2010

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three hosts are each given a budget of Â£5,000 to find a car that can hold its own on a racetrack and handle everyday tasks, before testing their purchases in Germany. James May puts two Porsches through their paces on the Top Gear test circuit, and former Downing Street communications director Alastair Campbell tries out the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Aisling Bea, Joe Lycett and David Mitchell join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended version of the unconventional quiz show. Tackling the topic of oceans, one of the questions touches on one publisher's suggestion for an improvement to Moby Dick. As ever, the quiz sees correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Clara Amfo, Anneka Rice and Al Murray test their general knowledge skills in more trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Warwick Davis, Paul Hollywood, Jason Manford and Joan Bakewell join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary, Mel Giedroyc, Josh Widdicombe and Matt Dawson join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Josh Widdicombe, Nathan Caton, Celia Pacquola
programme.desc: Sitcom star and The Last Leg regular Josh Widdicombe plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He'll be warming up the audience and then introducing routines by Londoner Nathan Caton and Celia Pacquola from Australia.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The race continues for Taskmaster Greg Davies's alluring golden head trophy. Today, an interesting selection of facial hair and a fascinating collection of continuous noises.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Broadcaster Sandi Toksvig and stand-up comedians Bill Bailey and Jason Manford join regular panellist Alan Davies for another round of the comedy quiz with a difference. Host Stephen Fry continues this series' exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions about lethal things.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topics of love and loveliness. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are stand-up and The Last Leg co-host Josh Widdicombe, Irish actress and comedienne Aisling Bea and author and comedian Tony Hawks.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: New World and Tina Charles perform on the vintage comedy and variety show, which includes sketches Patient, Wedding, Spoonerism and Hampton Wick.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Featuring Madeline Smith in spoof drama Hampton Wick, with Barker and Corbett paying homage to Gilbert and Sullivan in their grand musical finale.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: Historians Ruth Goodman, Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn continue to relive the golden age of steam and how the Victorian railways created modern Britain. They visit Beamish in County Durham, learning how the rail companies first realised there was money to be made in moving people rather than commodities. Then Peter and Alex live the life of navvies, the men who built the thousands of miles of tracks in all weather conditions, and Ruth finds out what impact the new railroads had on the cottage industries. She also learns about the role of the guard, and the trio learn what precautions were necessary for taking a long journey on a train that was yet to include the necessary facilities.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Rion-Antirion Bridge, which runs for 3kms and links the town of Rio on the Peloponnese peninsula to Antirrio on mainland Greece. Located in one of Europe's most active seismic zones, its engineers had to conquer the problems of deep water, high winds and constant land mass movement to build the colossal structure.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Series exploring ruined engineering projects that have been put to alternative use, including the site of the Chernobyl disaster and a Nazi holiday complex.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Lost Treasure of the Templars
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates whether the Knights Templar hid their treasure, looted from Jerusalem, on an uninhabited island in Mahone Bay, Nova Scotia.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Rion-Antirion Bridge, which runs for 3kms and links the town of Rio on the Peloponnese peninsula to Antirrio on mainland Greece. Located in one of Europe's most active seismic zones, its engineers had to conquer the problems of deep water, high winds and constant land mass movement to build the colossal structure.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Victoria and Albert's Highland Fling
programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits the Cairngorms National Park to discover how Queen Victoria and Prince Albert helped shape Scottish traditions and imagery, such as tartan, bagpipes and caber-tossing. Starting in Pitlochry, he traverses the Killiecrankie Pass, where the Jacobites won the Battle of Killiecrankie, and ends his trek at Balmoral and the fantasy castle Albert built as his and Victoria's Highland escape.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Portugal to meet leading experts on the Three Secrets of Fatima - a series of visions and prophecies allegedly given by the Virgin Mary to three young shepherds in 1917.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Series exploring ruined engineering projects that have been put to alternative use, including the site of the Chernobyl disaster and a Nazi holiday complex.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Abandoned projects of the space age, including the HARP gun in Barbados and the mountainside Barcroft Observatory in California.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.desc: New World and Tina Charles perform on the vintage comedy and variety show, which includes sketches Patient, Wedding, Spoonerism and Hampton Wick.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A wealthy land-owner's wife is strangled to death and her body dumped in a reservoir. Taggart and his partner Livingstone become suspicious when they discover the dead woman's husband was last seen preparing to leave for Switzerland - and carrying a large sum of money. Guest starring Alan Cumming.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sexual tension between Evie and Lord Montford intensifies during a tour of the Palace of Westminster. Drama, starring Stella Gonet.

programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Winsford Walled Garden in Devon, to answer the owner's horticultural queries.

programme.title: Monster Carp
programme.desc: Ali Hamidi, Neil Spooner and Tom Dove's mission to track down the world's largest carp takes them to Slovenia, visiting a remote lake full of submerged trees and a park lake that produced the country's record catch of almost 80lb.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Subjects include Cher, breakfast TV presenters and cocktails.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson presents the show from Hartlepool, helping members of the public sort the treasures from their trash and meeting one of the youngest sellers featured on the series.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which five members of a running club answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants who have never met before pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn prepares for Lucas' arrival, Harriet makes a shocking discovery, and Danny asks for Sarah's help.

programme.title: Britain's Busiest Motorway
programme.sub-title: Things That Go Bump in the Night
programme.desc: Traffic officers Andy and Keith are called out on the night shift to remove a cupboard from the carriageway, with the increased speed of the traffic putting them in serious danger. Back in the control room, Emily spots some loose horses causing chaos at Junction 23, while at junction 10 a bridge joint is being replaced and the engineers are in a race against time to get the job done before the sun rises.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show: Live
programme.desc: The presenter provides an annual financial health check for the nation in the wake of the Christmas expenses, offering up some 'Bill-Busting' advice on the best ways to cut the costs of energy, broadband, mobile phones, and digital TV bills. Plus, more questions from the audience in Ask Martin Anything.

programme.title: The National Television Awards Celebrate 25 Years
programme.desc: Julie Walters narrates a look back at the long-running awards show. Previous hosts Trevor McDonald and Dermot O'Leary share their memories of anchoring the event, while their successor, David Walliams, looks ahead to taking the reins for the 2020 show. Among the stars sharing their memories of past awards ceremonies are Graham Norton, Ant & Dec, Holly Willoughby, David Tennant, Simon Cowell, Paul O'Grady, Richard & Judy, Danny Dyer, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse, Brendan O'Carroll, Phillip Schofield, Julie Hesmondhalgh, Michael Barrymore, Eamonn Holmes and Davina McCall.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Ross Kemp and the Armed Police
programme.desc: In a follow-up documentary to last year's Ross Kemp and the Armed Police, the actor and film-maker follows tactical firearms units to investigate whether all police in the UK will one day be armed. With armed officers now a more regular presence on Britain's streets - in train stations and at airports - Ross goes out on a raid with a mobile undercover unit used to tackle new dangers with pre-emptive and confrontational tactics. He also gains access to their military-style training facility.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How Russian dolls are made, and the production of aloe vera and flags.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rust-free Triumph TR6 sports car from the 1970s that he wants to restore, but first mechanic Edd China has to rebuild the engine.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A Bentley Le Mans Replica is being flown in from England, with Wayne Carini excited to test drive it.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is ecstatic when an exceptional collection of motorcycles and a classic Ferrari, worth between five and eight million dollars, comes up for sale.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Terrifying Tornado, Free-Fall Fireball, Molten Metal
programme.desc: Footage of everything from human endurance and survival to calamitous engineering failures, including a devastating natural disaster.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Unravelling Underwater, Skydive Scramble, Russian Rumble
programme.desc: More footage hair-raising disaster footage, including a dizzying perspective on a skydiving accident.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A stunt driver is crushed by his all-terrain vehicle after a backflip goes wrong in Mexico, and a fire turns a 32-storey Madrid high-rise into a ruin.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Dozens of barrels containing volatile chemicals explode, and the test flight of a military jet ends in a crash on the runway. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: American Loggers
programme.desc: The mills turn back timber, the Pelletiers struggle for profit, and a stand of massive pine trees forces the company to harvest the old-fashioned way.

programme.title: Darts: BDO World Championships
programme.desc: Highlights of day three from indigo at the O2 in London.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Detectives fear for the safety of a girl abducted from a trailer park, and struggle to pick out a chief suspect after discovering several sex offenders live in the area.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How convictions were secured in three murder cases through the gathering of trace evidence, including luminol blood testing and fingerprinting.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The case of Oklahoma teenagers Sarah Edmondson and Ben Darras, who decided to take the road trip from hell in March 1995. Their crimes were random, senseless and without remorse. Darras shot and killed businessman William Savage in Mississippi and Edmondson seriously wounded store clerk Patsy Byers in Louisiana.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 25-year-old waitress Zilpha Lowery who vanished in July 1993. Foul play was immediately suspected as rumours of Lowery's fate spread through her North Carolina town and tied her to another mysterious disappearance. Her body was found with its skull crushed several months later, but it would be another 13 years before a tip led detectives out of state to find their man.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI is called in to investigate a double murder after a corrupt local government hinders the police.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.sub-title: The Hunt for a Dogfight Kingpin
programme.desc: Two abused pit bulls are seized from dog fighters, 16 feral cats are rescued from an abandoned house and a lost bird is returned home.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A cockatiel is brought in with a broken leg, and Chris Brown carries out a radical treatment involving a pencil, pilates and sticky tape.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown looks after a greyhound that has been dumped after it failed to prove its worth on the racing track.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Am a Bride on a Budget
programme.desc: A struggling actress resolves to pay for her own dress, while a customer falls in love with a dress that is over her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dawn searches for a princess gown for her wedding, but cannot find anything that lives up to her standards.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Kari wants a conservative dress, but her mother is looking for something more revealing, while Nita's couture tastes do not fit with her mother's off-the-rack budget.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: A cat is brought into the clinic soon after giving birth, could there be another kitten on the way? Plus, Alison and Audrey check out some lumps on a golden retriever.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Barbara Christiansen rescues two emaciated dogs, leaving the Houston SPCA team with a fight to save the animals' lives.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Max Mixson rescues a seriously injured dog and surgeons battle to save its life.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades visits the recycling centre in Altrincham, Greater Manchester, where items include a collection of old tiles and a conservatory sofa.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How modern investigation techniques coupled with broken shards from a car headlight helped in the case of a hit-and-run death of a Michigan cyclist, leading officers to both the vehicle and its driver.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Examining evidence to determine how a fire broke out in the home of an elderly couple and whether their son was to blame, despite his pleas of innocence.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of interior designer William 'Billy' McGrath, a self-made millionaire, who went missing in August 2009. His body was located two years later, buried under a house, some months after handyman Brad Tocker had been arrested on suspicion of fraud and identification theft.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass re-investigate the case of Edward Devlin and Alfred Burns, who were arrested and sentenced to death for the 1951 murder of Liverpudlian Beatrice Rimmer.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Here Comes the Bride Again - and Again
programme.desc: Keasha bonds with cancer survivor Jennifer during the search for a dress, and a bad-tempered bride takes her frustrations out on Vera.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Two brides from Baltimore come to the bridal store for a joint appointment - but they have very different ideas, while new fashion director Randy is ready to make his mark.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: An interfering mother of the bride makes things difficult for Diane, while Keesha gets good news about the lump she found in her breast.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman who is renewing her wedding vows brings her two sons with her to choose her dress, but struggles when they do not approve of her choice.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Rochelle brings her family over from California to help her choose her dress, including her opinionated father, and a girl finds it difficult to stay within her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Chaos hits the store with the launch of the annual sale, as queues form outside the building and the owner breaks his own strict rules.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The store's buyers head to Bridal Market Week, a crucial event where designers showcase their latest trends, while Sarah helps an Islamic bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kleinfeld's welcomes a variety of clients, from a bride with a liking for vintage fashion, to a biker chick with more outlandish tastes.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard is blown away by an 18th-century mansion on the edge of the Yorkshire Moors, and goes deep below ground at a Liverpool cathedral to unearth religious artefacts.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades visits the recycling centre in Altrincham, Greater Manchester, where items include a collection of old tiles and a conservatory sofa.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Gideon, who weighs 650lbs, is desperate to address his problem, so uproots his family to restart his life with weight-loss surgery and hopes for a happier future.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the lives of people, each weighing over 600lbs. Through their year-long journeys, they attempt to lose thousands of pounds collectively, to survive.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Bureau agents track down seven dangerous criminals who have escaped from a Texas prison, robbed a store and killed a policeman.
